title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 210.8 - Calendaring of motions; uniform notice of motion form
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 210.8 - Calendaring of motions; uniform notice of motion form

State Regulations
(a) There shall be compliance
with the procedures prescribed in the UCCA and CPLR for the bringing of
motions. In addition, no motion shall be filed with the court unless a notice
of motion is served and filed with the motion papers. The notice of motion
shall read substantially as follows: CITY COURT OF THE CITY OF
COUNTY OF ________............ x
A. B., Notice of Motion

Plaintiff, Index No. -against-
_____________
Name of Assigned Judge
C. D., Oral argument is requested [ ]
check box if requested)

Defendant............. X
Upon the affidavit of ________, sworn to on
________, 19________, and upon (list supporting papers if any), the
________will move this court at the ________ Courthouse, ________, ________, New York, on the ________ day of ________, 19________, at ________ (a.m.)
(p.m.) for an order (briefly indicate relief requested). The above-entitled action is for (briefly
state nature of action, e.g., personal injury, contract, property damage etc.). Pursuant to CPLR 2214(b), answering affidavits, if any, are required to be
served upon the undersigned at least seven days before the return date of the
motion. (check box if applicable) [ ]
Dated: (Print Name)............ Attorney1 (or Attorney in charge of case if
law firm) for moving party

Address: Telephone number: (Print Name)
TO:............ Attorney1 for (other party)

Address: Telephone number: (Print Name)............ Attorney1 for (other party)

Address: Telephone number: ________
1 If any party is appearing pro se, the name, address and telephone number of such party shall be stated. (b) The notice of motion set
forth in subdivision (a) of this section shall not be required for the return
of an order to show cause or an application for ex parte relief. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
210.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
